title: Is an iPhone 9 coming out soon? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is no “iPhone 9” since Apple hasn’t announced anything by that name. The only people calling the next iPhone by that name are the rumor mill and people who are gullible enough to believe rumors without question. The COVID-19 pandemic isn’t having an impact on Apple’s product releases. Just this week Apple released new models of the iPad Pro, MacBook Air, and Mac mini. And there is no evidence Apple will change the release timing from what previous iPhone models have used. So you can expect the next new model to be released around the same time of year. Finally WWDC hasn’t been cancelled either. It’s simply online-only this year. There will be more workshops than ever for developers this year. Nothing of substance has been cancelled.

User-11617046030307725331 , I believe the release is later this month on the 12th. According to Forbes, the main problem is the naming of the new phones. They’re going with an XS with the OLED display, a new X and an update on the 8. “ Tim Cook has decided this is an ’S’ year in terms of naming protocols.” Apple Loop: iPhone XS Launch Confirmed September 12, New iPhone SE 2 Leaked, Apple's Scared Approach  The 9 is coming out this year: “According to rumours, the iPhone 9 will be the most-affordable in Apple's 2018 iPhones. Apple guru Ming-Chi Kuo expects the smartphone to retail for $600-$700 (around £450-£530)” iPhone 11: Apple 'Gather Round' event scheduled for 12 September at Cupertino HQ | TheINQUIRER
